A sonnet is a poem in a specific form which originated in Italy; Giacomo Da 
Lentini is credited with its invention. The term sonnet is derived from the Italian 
word sonetto (from Old Provenal sonet a little poem, from son song, from Latin 
sonus a sound). By the thirteenth century it signified a poem of fourteen lines that 
follows a ... Writers of sonnets are sometimes called "sonneteers", although the 
term can...
